TITLE: Atlanta DA asks FBI for security assessment after Trump calls for protests over election probe
SUMMARY: Donald Trump lashed out against a Georgia prosecutor investigating him for trying to get the victory of President Joe Biden reversed in that state.

TITLE: UK investigation into Downing Street Covid lockdown parties finds ‘failures of leadership’
SUMMARY: U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson has so far resisted calls to resign despite public anger over a long and growing list of alleged lockdown breaches.

TITLE: Ukraine calls for peaceful solution to Russian military buildup as Russia, U.S. spar at U.N. meeting
SUMMARY: Ukraine pushed for a diplomatic solution to a Russian military buildup at its border during a U.N. Security Council meeting.

TITLE: Just a 'handful of weeks' left to strike nuclear deal with Iran, official says
SUMMARY: The official said that the U.S. was not imposing an "artificial deadline" or "an ultimatum."

TITLE: Companies founded by Pharma Bro Martin Shkreli will pay up to $28M in class-action settlement over Daraprim price hike
SUMMARY: Martin Shkreli raised the price of the prescription drug Daraprim by more than 4,000. He recently was banned for life from the pharmaceutical industry.

TITLE: Kyrsten Sinema raises over $1.5 million in fourth quarter while opposing key pieces of Biden agenda
SUMMARY: Sen. Kyrsten Sinema raised over $1.5 million toward the end of 2021 as she opposed key elements of her own party's agenda, according to new filings.

TITLE: Here's what to watch for as Biden decides on his Supreme Court pick
SUMMARY: Biden reaffirmed his campaign vow to nominate a Black woman to replace Justice Stephen Breyer on the Supreme Court and plans to announce his choice this month.

TITLE: Democratic Sen. Ben Ray Lujan suffered a stroke, which could complicate Biden's Supreme Court plans
SUMMARY: Sen. Ben Ray Lujan, a Democrat, is "expected to make a full recovery" after suffering a stroke in his cerebellum, his chief of staff said in a statement.

TITLE: Republican super PACs outraise Democratic rivals ahead of midterm congressional elections
SUMMARY: Republican-led super PACs outraised their Democratic rivals in the latter half of last year, giving them more firepower ahead of this year's midterm elections.

TITLE: Authorities raid Michigan home of high-ranking Homeland Security official Vance Callender
SUMMARY: The raid at the home of Vance Callender came two years after he was put in charge of agents in Michigan and Ohio for a division of the Homeland Security Department.

TITLE: Putin says the West has ignored Russia's security concerns over NATO and Ukraine
SUMMARY: "It's already clear now ... that fundamental Russian concerns were ignored," Putin said at a press conference Tuesday, according to a Reuters translation.

TITLE: U.S. to move 3,000 troops closer to Ukraine as Russia crisis escalates
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden has not committed to sending U.S. combat troops directly to Ukraine but will instead send some to neighboring NATO countries.

TITLE: Economist Lisa Cook is poised to make history at the Fed – but first she must face a grilling from senators
SUMMARY: Lisa Cook will be joined by Sarah Bloom Raskin and Philip Jefferson during a nomination hearing before the Senate Banking Committee on Thursday.

TITLE: Homeland Security official Vance Callender on administrative leave after raid on Michigan home, lawyer says
SUMMARY: Vance Callender has served as the top Homeland Security Investigations agent in Michigan and Ohio since 2020. He is under investigation for unknown reasons.

TITLE: New Yorker who dressed as a caveman during Jan. 6 Capitol riot pleads guilty to felony charge
SUMMARY: Hundreds of former President Trump's supporters, spurred by his false claims about election fraud, temporarily stopped Congress from confirming Biden's victory.

TITLE: CNN boss Jeff Zucker resigns, says he failed to disclose office relationship with former Andrew Cuomo aide
SUMMARY: Jeff Zucker said in his resignation that he should have admitted to his relationship with CNN executive Allison Gollust during a probe of Chris Cuomo

TITLE: Democratic Sen. Ben Ray Lujan expected back to work in 4-6 weeks after surgery for stroke
SUMMARY: As Lujan recovers, President Biden and Democrats are working to nominate and confirm a new Supreme Court justice following news of Stephen Breyer's retirement.

TITLE: Alphabet stock's big day could mean a windfall for Nancy Pelosi's husband
SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband, an investment manager and options trader, could be up big on Wednesday with Alphabet's equity pop.

TITLE: U.S. forces kill ISIS leader during counterterrorism raid in Syria, White House says
SUMMARY: U.S. forces killed the leader of terrorist group ISIS, Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi, during a raid in Syria, the White House said Thursday.

TITLE: ISIS leader dies during U.S. counterterrorism raid in Syria, White House says
SUMMARY: The leader of terrorist group ISIS, Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi, died during a U.S. raid in Syria, the White House said Thursday.

TITLE: Man previously arrested for parking SUV in front of Supreme Court returned to the same spot, police say
SUMMARY: The man, Dale Paul Melvin, has "parked his Chevy Tahoe in front of the Court again," U.S. Capitol Police said in a tweet at 9:46 a.m. ET.

TITLE: Former Joe Manchin aides lobbied his office, Congress on Build Back Better during lead-up to senator rejecting bill
SUMMARY: Sen. Joe Manchin, a conservative Democrat from West Virginia, is a pivotal vote in the Senate, which is split 50-50.

TITLE: Fed influence, shaky forecasts, delayed decisions: How the Biden administration misread the inflation threat
SUMMARY: The Biden administration misread the rising threat of inflation for a variety of reasons, according to several economists and current and former officials.

TITLE: Black unemployment rate dips, labor force participation rises in January
SUMMARY: The Black unemployment rate dipped to 6.9% in January from 7.1%.

TITLE: House competition bill aims to boost minorities in science and technology
SUMMARY: The bill includes authorizing $900 million for grants and partnerships with historically Black colleges and universities.

TITLE: Biden visits site of Pittsburgh bridge collapse before speech on infrastructure
SUMMARY: Biden was set to tout the $1 trillion bipartisan infrastructure law, which he signed into law after years of failed efforts by ex-President Donald Trump.

TITLE: 'President Trump is wrong': Mike Pence rejects ex-boss's false claim that he had power to overturn election
SUMMARY: Mike Pence said that his former boss, ex-President Trump, is "wrong" to claim that he could have overturned the results of the 2020 presidential election.

TITLE: RNC calls Jan. 6 pro-Trump riot 'legitimate political discourse' as it votes to censure GOP Reps. Liz Cheney and Adam Kinzinger
SUMMARY: Cheney and Kinzinger are the only Republicans on the select committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol riot by former President Donald Trump's supporters.

TITLE: Biden says January jobs gains prove the economy is no longer at the mercy of Covid
SUMMARY: The U.S. economy has finally broken free of the sharp ups and downs of Covid, President Joe Biden said Friday, citing January's jobs gains.

TITLE: Michael Avenatti found guilty in fraud trial over Stormy Daniels book money
SUMMARY: Michael Avenatti, a former top critic of ex-President Donald Trump, represented porn star Stormy Daniels in various legal fights connected to Trump.

TITLE: Just a 'handful of weeks' left to strike nuclear deal with Iran, official says
SUMMARY: The official said that the U.S. was not imposing an "artificial deadline" or "an ultimatum."

TITLE: Companies founded by Pharma Bro Martin Shkreli will pay up to $28M in class-action settlement over Daraprim price hike
SUMMARY: Martin Shkreli raised the price of the prescription drug Daraprim by more than 4,000. He recently was banned for life from the pharmaceutical industry.

TITLE: Democratic Sen. Ben Ray Lujan expected back to work in 4-6 weeks after surgery for stroke
SUMMARY: As Lujan recovers, President Biden and Democrats are working to nominate and confirm a new Supreme Court justice following news of Stephen Breyer's retirement.

TITLE: Homeland Security official Vance Callender on administrative leave after raid on Michigan home, lawyer says
SUMMARY: Vance Callender has served as the top Homeland Security Investigations agent in Michigan and Ohio since 2020. He is under investigation for unknown reasons.

TITLE: National Archives retrieved 15 boxes of Trump White House documents from Mar-a-Lago
SUMMARY: The records retrieved from Mar-a-Lago should have been handed over to the National Archives once Trump left office as required by the Presidential Records Act.

TITLE: Trump SPAC stock Digital World Acquisition Corp. plunges after news spreads of delayed app launch
SUMMARY: The stock price of Digital World Acquisition Corp., which has partnered with ex-President Donald Trump's social media app firm, fell in late-day trading.

TITLE: Democratic dark money groups prepare campaign to support Biden's Supreme Court nominee
SUMMARY: Democratic dark money groups are gearing up for a multimillion-dollar campaign to back President Joe Biden's eventual nominee to the Supreme Court.

TITLE: Biden says Nord Stream 2 won’t go forward if Russia invades Ukraine, but German Chancellor demurs
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz had a rare show of disunity Monday over the fate of the Nord Stream 2 pipeline if Russia invades Ukraine.

TITLE: Senate GOP leader Mitch McConnell rips RNC for censuring Cheney, Kinzinger over probe of pro-Trump Capitol riot
SUMMARY: Jan. 6 was "a violent insurrection," McConnell said, pushing back on the RNC description of that day's events as "legitimate political discourse."

TITLE: Vice President Kamala Harris' spouse, Doug Emhoff, evacuated from a high school due to a bomb threat
SUMMARY: Second gentleman Doug Emhoff was rushed out of a Washington high school on Tuesday because of a bomb threat, school administrators and White House aides said.

TITLE: House passes short-term government funding bill that would prevent shutdown, sends it to Senate
SUMMARY: The Senate plans to pass the temporary government funding bill before a Feb. 18 deadline to prevent a shutdown.

TITLE: Biden finally acknowledges Tesla's EV leadership after a year of silence
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Tuesday acknowledged Tesla and the company's status as the nation's largest producer of electric vehicles.

TITLE: Congress moves toward banning members from trading stocks
SUMMARY: After years of resistance, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has greenlighted a plan to ban members of Congress from trading stocks, CNBC confirmed Wednesday.

TITLE: Some Trump allies want him to pull his endorsement of Texas Gov. Greg Abbott ahead of GOP primary
SUMMARY: Donald Trump's team has heard from allies who are trying to encourage the former president to withdraw his support for Texas Gov. Greg Abbott.

TITLE: Trump lawyer Rudy Giuliani and other aides asked GOP prosecutor to give them Michigan county voting machines after 2020 election, report says
SUMMARY: Giuliani was scheduled to sit this week for a deposition as part of the House select committee's investigation of the Jan. 6 Capitol riot by a pro-Trump mob.

TITLE: Congress moves to ban members from trading stocks as Pelosi drops opposition
SUMMARY: After months of resistance, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has greenlighted a plan to ban members of Congress from trading stocks, CNBC confirmed Wednesday.

TITLE: Jan. 6 riot panel subpoenas Trump aide Peter Navarro over alleged plot to delay certification of Biden's win
SUMMARY: The Jan. 6 Capitol riot probe committee wants to question Trump aide Peter Navarro about efforts to delay certification of President Joe Biden's election win.

TITLE: House probe of Jan. 6 Capitol riot finds long gap in White House phone records
SUMMARY: It is unknown whether the gap in the records is the result of Trump's habit of using his personal cell phone as president, NBC reported.

TITLE: Biden touts wage growth, slower inflation forecasts after another surge in prices
SUMMARY: Biden touted wages and forecasts for weaker price growth even after the consumer inflation report showed prices are rising at their fastest clip in 40 years.

TITLE: Hillary Clinton expected to speak at New York Democratic convention
SUMMARY: Hillary Clinton is expected to speak at next week's New York State Democratic Party Convention, according to people familiar with the matter.

TITLE: Crypto, China, stocks and more: Democrats and Republicans are actually working together on some crucial issues
SUMMARY: Voters and Washington are bitterly divided. But Democrats and Republicans in Congress have found some common ground on crypto, China, stocks and other issues.

TITLE: Connecticut governor says Covid mask mandate can be lifted because 'hospitals aren't overwhelmed'
SUMMARY: "The most important metric for me is hospitalizations. We want to make sure our hospitals aren't overwhelmed," Gov. Ned Lamont told CNBC on Thursday.

TITLE: Biden predicts his Supreme Court nominee will get Republican votes
SUMMARY: Biden is aiming to reveal his pick to replace Stephen Breyer by the end of the month. He said he has "done the deep dive" on about four candidates so far.

TITLE: Frozen embryos will keep accused $4.5 billion bitcoin money launderers from fleeing U.S., lawyer says in bail bid
SUMMARY: Heather Morgan and Ilya Lichtenstein are accused of a conspiracy to launder bitcoin that was stolen in the 2016 hack of Bitfinex, a cryptocurrency exchange.

TITLE: KC Fed chief confirmed Biden nominee Sarah Bloom Raskin personally lobbied for fintech firm, GOP senator says
SUMMARY: Biden Federal Reserve nominee Sarah Bloom Raskin called Kansas City Fed President Esther George to advocate for a fintech company, Sen. Pat Toomey says.

TITLE: Biden meets with leaders of NATO, US allies to discuss Russia's military threat to Ukraine
SUMMARY: Biden's meeting with the leaders of France, Germany, the United Kingdom and other allies was not included in his official schedule.
